DEMAND_GEO.FILE: ENTER FILE PATH TO DEMAND GEOGRAPHIC BOUNDARY SHAPEFILE

ID.NAME: ENTER DEMAND GEOGRAPHIC BOUNDARY ID VARIABLE NAME

LRG_ID.NAME: TO FOLLOW UP WITH CHELSEA ON THIS REQUIREMENT

DEMAND_POP.FILE: ENTER FILE PATH TO THE DEMAND GEOGRAPHIC BOUNDARY SHAPEFILES' POPULATION CSV

ID.NAME: ENTER DEMAND GEOGRAPHIC BOUNDARY ID VARIABLE NAME

DEMAND_TOTAL.NAME: TO FOLLOW UP WITH CHELSEA ON THIS REQUIREMENT

DEMAND_ENTER WORD THAT DESCRIBES POPULAT.NAME: ENTER THE VARIABLE NAME
DEMAND_ENTER WORD THAT DESCRIBES POPULAT.TYPE: ENTER HOW YOU WANT THE VARIABLE NAME TO APPEAR ON THE UI

DEMAND_GEO_WEIGHT.FILE: ENTER FILE PATH TO A MORE GRANULAR DEMAND GEOGRAPHIC BOUNDARY SHAPEFILES. THIIS FILE IS OPTIONAL. REMOVE THIS ENTIRE OBJECT IF NOT NEEDED

ID.NAME: ENTER SMALLER DEMAND GEOGRAPHIC BOUNDARY ID VARIABLE NAME

LRG_ID.NAME: ENTER DEMAND GEOGRAPHIC BOUNDARY ID VARIABLE NAME

POI.FILE: ENTER FILE PATH TO THE SUPPLY CSV

LATITUDE.NAME: ENTER LATITUDE VARIABLE NAME
LATITUDE.UNIT: ENTER DATA TYPE OF LATITUDE (E.G., float)

LONGITUDE.NAME: ENTER LONGITUDE VARIABLE NAME
LONGITUDE.UNIT: ENTER DATA TYPE OF LONGITUDE (E.G., float)

ENTER DESCRIPTIVE WORD OF VARIALBLE TO I.NAME: ENTER VARIABLE NAME
ENTER DESCRIPTIVE WORD OF VARIALBLE TO I.TYPE: ENTER HOW YOU WANT THE VARIABLE NAME TO APPEAR ON THE UI

SUPPLY_ENTER DESCRIPTIVE WORD OF VARIABL.NAME: ENTER VARIABLE NAME
SUPPLY_ENTER DESCRIPTIVE WORD OF VARIABL.TYPE: ENTER HOW YOU WANT THE VARIABLE NAME TO APPEAR ON THE UI

CAPACITY_ENTER DESCRIPTIVE WORD OF VARIA.NAME: ENTER VARIABLE NAME
CAPACITY_ENTER DESCRIPTIVE WORD OF VARIA.TYPE: ENTER HOW YOU WANT THE VARIABLE NAME TO APPEAR ON THE UI

LOGGER.FILE: ENTER true OR false TO SAVE LOG AS FILE
LOGGER.FILE_PATH: ENTER A PATH AND FILE NAME (E.G., pass.log) TO SAVE FILE IN (IF FILE IS true)

BASEMAP.TOKEN: ENTER API KEY TO BASEMAP. CURRENT URL IN map.js DEPENDS ON MAPBOX API KEY. CHANGE tiles VAR IF WANTING DIFFERENT PROVIDOR

META.TITLE: PASS
META.DESCRIPTION: Potential Accessibility Software Service (PASS), a geographic information system that offers a quantitative approach to measure how spatially accessible population demand is to a given in-person service.

NAVBAR.LOGO: ENTER LOGO TO APPEAR ON TOP-LEFT NAVBAR

BTNS.NAME: ENTER NAME A NAVBAR BTN NAME (E.G., Help)
BTNS.TITLE: ENTER A HEADER THAT WILL APPEAR AT THE TOP OF THIS NAVBAR MODAL VIEW

SECTIONS.HEADER: ENTER A HEADER THAT WILL APPEAR WITHIN THE BODY OF THE NAVBAR MODAL

CONTENT.P: ENTER TEXT THAT WILL APPEAR IN A PARAGRAPH

MENU.NAME: ENTER ANOTHER TERM FOR MENU FOR BTN WHEN TOGGLING MENU
MENU.DESC: ENTER DESCRIPTION OF TOOL THAT WILL APPEAR IN THE MENU

PARAMS.LABEL: Willingness to Commute
PARAMS.TOOLTIP: Select how willing clients are to travel further distance.

PARAMS.LABEL: Population Group
PARAMS.TOOLTIP: Select the variable to represent the population demand.

PARAMS.LABEL: POI Supply
PARAMS.TOOLTIP: Select the variable to represent the supply of the service locations (POIs) that meets the demand.

PARAMS.LABEL: POI Capacity
PARAMS.TOOLTIP: Select the variable to represent the capacity of the service locations (POIs) that would influences the likelihood of demand going to the POI.

PARAMS.LABEL: Distance Travel Threshold:
PARAMS.TOOLTIP: Select the max distance clients are willing to travel to the service. Consider mode of transportation.

MENU.SUBMIT: ENTER TEXT TO APPEAR IN THE BUTTON THAT RUNS THE MODEL
